non_residential_details.development_type: Change of Use with Extension(s) over 999sqm

description: Construction of rear extensions at first to seventh floors at 43-47 New Broadway and the Change of Use of the upper floors from Language School (Use Class D1) and 5 flats (Use Class C3) to a 124 room apart hotel (Use Class C1); Construction of extension above the rear portion of 33 New Broadway along the Bond Street frontage to create 6 flats (Use Class C3); Excavation to create basement level for associated ancillary areas for commercial and apart hotel, including plant and equipment; Reconfiguration and provision of commercial floor space (to 33-57 New Broadway) at the ground and basement floor (Use Class A1 and A3); and two first floor level (east and west) communal deck amenity areas at the rear.
decision_conditions: 1. The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

2. The development hereby approved shall be retained in accordance with drawing title number(s): 1730 PL1-01 - Site Location Plan, 1730 PL1-02 Rev. A - Block Plan, 1730 PL1-03 Rev. A - Existing Site Plan, 1730 PL1-04 Rev. D - Proposed Site Plan at Ground Floor Level, 1730 PL1-05 Rev. E - Proposed Site Plan at First Floor Level, 1730 PL1-10 Rev. A - Existing Ground Floor Plan, 1730 PL1-11 Rev. A - Existing First Floor Plan, 1730 PL1-12 Rev. A - Existing Second Floor Plan, 1730 PL1-13 Rev. A - Existing Third Floor Plan, 1730 PL1-14 Rev. A - Existing Roof Plan, 1730 PL1-15 Rev. A - Existing North Elevation, 1730 PL1-16 Rev. A - Existing West Elevation, 1730 PL1-17 Rev. A - Existing South Elevation, 1730 PL1-18 Rev. A - Existing East Elevation, 1730 PL1-19 Rev. A - Existing Section A-A, 1730 PL1-20 Rev. A - Proposed Basement Floor Plan, 1730 PL1-21 Rev. G - Proposed Ground Floor Plan, 1730 PL1-22 Rev. H - Proposed Ground Floor Plan, 1730 PL1-23 Rev. F - Proposed 1st Floor Plan, 1730 PL1-24 Rev. F - Proposed 2nd Floor Plan, 1730 PL1-25 Rev. F - Proposed 3rd Floor Plan, 1730 PL1-26 Rev. E - Proposed 4th Floor Plan, 1730 PL1-27 Rev. E - Proposed 5th Floor Plan, 1730 PL1-28 Rev. E - Proposed 7thFloor Plan, 1730 PL1-29 Rev. F - Proposed Roof Plan, 1730 PL1-30 Rev. C - Proposed North Elevation A, 1730 PL1-31 Rev. C - Proposed West Elevation B, 1730 PL1-32 Rev. C - Proposed East Elevation C, 1730 PL1-33 Rev. C - Proposed East Elevation D, 1730 PL1-34 Rev. C - Proposed West Elevation E, 1730 PL1-35 Rev. C - Proposed Section A-A, 1730 PL1-36 Rev. C - Proposed Section B-B, 1730 PL1-37 Rev. C- Proposed Context Elevations, 1730 PL1-38 Rev. C - Proposed Context Elevations,
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

3. All external materials to be used in the development shall be in accordance with those as described on the plans and application documents. Samples and a schedule of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application. Development shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and Policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7B of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013), polices 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (f) of the adopted Development (Core) Strategy (2013).

4. A detailed construction method statement (including the construction of the basement) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced. The statement shall include details of phasing and programming, removal of earth from site; construction methods; site management and access; vehicle and machinery specifications and numbers/frequency of vehicles/deliveries, construction worker parking, anticipated number, delivery times, dust suppression measures, site security, vehicle manoeuvring and turning, locations for the storage of building materials and construction debris and contractors offices, procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents, measures to ensure the construction process does not effect of neighbouring highways, details of wheel water spraying facilities and noise/vibration mitigation measures. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved method statement.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with 1.1 (e) (j) 1.2 (f), 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 6.3, 6.13,  7.14 and 7.15  of the London Plan (2016), the National Planning Policy Framework (2012), Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise.
5. Prior to the commencement of development, a Construction Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The plan shall include the following:
- the parking of vehicles of site operatives and visitors;
- loading and unloading of plant and materials;
- storage of plant and materials used in constructing the development;
- the erection and maintenance of security hoarding including decorative displays and facilities for public viewing, where appropriate;
- wheel washing facilities;
- measures to control the emission of dust and dirt during demolition and construction; and
- a scheme for recycling/disposing of waste resulting from demolition and construction works
- No encroachment on the clear space needed to maintain the safe and uninterrupted flow of road users and pedestrians;
- Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents.

The Construction Management Plan shall be implemented on commencement of any works on site and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the duration of demolition and construction.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (f) (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policy 6.3 of the London Plan (2016) and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan.

6. Prior to first occupation of any part of the development hereby approved, details of refuse and recycling storage, together with an Operational Waste Management Plan, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by Local Planning Authority. The development shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage, in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards, has been provided in the curtilage of the proposed building and has been fully implemented and made available for use. The approved details and facilities shall be implemented as approved and retained in operation thereafter for the life of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies 5.16, and 5.17 of the London Plan (2016).

7. Five (5) car parking spaces shall be provided in accordance with the submitted details including 2 disabled car spaces; 1 car space with an active electric car charging point; 1 car space with a passive electric car charging point; and 1 car spaces for servicing and deliveries.
Reason: To provide car parking to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and policy 6.13 of the London Plan (2016).

8. Cycle storage for a minimum of forty five (45) covered secure bicycle spaces including five (5) adaptable spaces shall be provided onsite in accordance with all adopted standards prior to occupation of the building and be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.
Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and policy 6.9 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016).

9. Building envelope insulation for the approved residential building, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, shall be installed to achieve the internal noise targets adopted by the local planning authority:
- Bedrooms (23:00-0700 hrs) 30 dB LAeq, and 45 dB Lmax (fast).
- Living rooms (0700-2300 hrs) 35dB LAeq.
- Kitchens, bathrooms, WC and utility rooms (0700-2300 hrs) 45 dB LAeq.
The sound insulation measures shall be installed and fully completed prior to the first use and / or first occupation of the units and maintained thereafter.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 7.15 of the London Plan (2016); Policy 1.1(j) of Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and interim SPG 10: Noise and Vibration.

10. The rating noise level emitted from the external plant and machinery at the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142: 2014, shall not exceed the existing background sound level, as measured at the nearest noise sensitive facades.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 7.15 of the London Plan (2016); Policy 1.1(j) of Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and interim SPG 10: Noise and Vibration.

11. The insulation of the floor/ceiling between the commercial premises and the residential units shall achieve an acoustic standard not exceeding NR 25 Leq 5mins, (octaves) or NR 20 Leq 5mins, (one-third octaves) inside a bedroom and NR 30 Leq,5mins (octaves), 0r NR 25 Leq,5mins (one-third octaves), inside a living room when noise is generated from the commercial use.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development and living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'.
12. The developer shall draw to the attention of the Local Planning Authority the presence of any unsuspected contamination encountered during the development.

In the event of contamination to land and/or water being encountered, no development shall continue until a programme of investigation and/or remedial work to include methods of monitoring and certification of such work undertaken has been submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

None of the development shall be occupied until the approved remedial works, monitoring and certification of the works have been carried out and a full validation report has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

In the event that no contamination is encountered, the developer shall provide a written statement to the Local Planning Authority confirming that this was the case, and only after written approval by the Local Planning Authority shall the development be occupied.

Reason: To ensure that any ground and water contamination is identified and adequately addressed to ensure the safety of the development, the environment and to ensure the site is suitable for the proposed use in accordance with  policy 5.21 of the London Plan (2016).

13. Details of the proposed upgrades to the access laneway and rear car parking/residential entry area shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of works on site. The details shall include proposed treatment of the spaces to ensure a high quality and safe pedestrian environment for access and egress of future occupiers including visual differentiation between vehicular and pedestrian access/egress and the proposed bollard entry system.

Reason: To provide safe pedestrian and vehicular access in accordance with policies 6.10, 7.3 and 7.4, 7.13 of the London Plan (2016), policies 7.3 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan and Interim SPG 8: Safer Ealing.

14. An access, delivery and servicing plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, prior to first occupation of any part of the development hereby approved. The plan shall cover the following:
- How access will be control and managed via the bollards
- Residential vehicular access and operation
- Deliveries and collections
- Emergency Vehicle access
- Servicing trips (including maintenance and postal vans)
- Cleaning and waste removal
- Control of vehicle movements within the internal access road and public realm
- Management and security of disabled parking
- Monitoring and review of operations

The delivery and servicing plan shall be implemented on first occupation of any part of the development hereby approved and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the life of the development, or as otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure that the development can be adequately serviced in the interests of pedestrian and highway safety, in accordance with policy 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan 2016 and Local Variation policy 6.13 of the Development Management DPD 2013.

15. No microwave masts, antennae or satellite dishes or any other plant or equipment shall be installed on any of the buildings containing flats (Use Class C3) or the apart-hotel (Use Class C1) hereby permitted unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the buildings in the interests of visual amenity in accordance with policy 1.1(h) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, Local Variation policies 3.5 and 7.4 and policies 7B and 7C of the Development Management DPD 2013.
16. The A1 (retail) use hereby approved at the ground floor shall not operate outside of the hours of 0600hrs to 0000hrs.

Reason: To safeguard the future and adjoining occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, Local Variation policy 3.5 and policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013.

17. a) Prior to the first occupation of the residential units within the approved development, the approved dwellings shall incorporate sustainability measures as detailed in the approved Sustainable Design and Construction Statement (2 March 2017), prepared by eb7 Ltd

b) Prior to the first use of the commercial units within the approved development, the approved non-residential units shall incorporate sustainability measures as detailed in the approved Sustainable Design and Construction Statement (2 March 2017), prepared by eb7 Ltd.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan 2016, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD 2013, and policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2012.

18. Prior to the first occupation of the development proposing the construction of residential units, the approved dwellings shall incorporate and maintain measures to ensure that the residential units will meet water efficiency standards with a maximum water use target of 105 litres of water per person per day.
Reason: To ensure the sustainable use of water, in accordance with policy 5.15 of the London Plan 2016.

19. a) Prior to first occupation of the apartments within the development, the approved dwellings shall incorporate and maintain mitigation measures that will assist with reducing the risk of overheating, follow the cooling hierarchy and comply with CIBSE TM49 & TM59 criteria, as stated within the approved Sustainable Design and Construction Statement (2 March 2017), prepared by eb7 Ltd.

b)    Prior to first use of the non- residential units within the development, the approved non-residential spaces shall incorporate and maintain mitigation measures that will assist with reducing the risk of overheating, follow the cooling hierarchy and comply with CIBSE TM49 & TM52/59 criteria, as stated within the approved Sustainable Design and Construction Statement (2 March 2017), prepared by eb7 Ltd.

Reason: To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to reduce the risk of overheating in line with policy 5.9 of the London Plan 2016, adopted Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (3rd April 2012) and Development Management DPD (December 2013).

20. a) Within three-months of practical completion of each dwelling and non-residential units in the approved development, Energy Performance Certificates [EPC's], detailed modelling output reports showing clearly the DER/BER and TER from the "as built stage" to confirm compliance in terms of savings achieved through energy efficiency measures shall be submitted for written approval by the Local Authority.

b) Within three-months of the practical completion of the dwellings and non-residential units, technical information and evidence that the renewable/low carbon technologies are certified under the Microgeneration Certification Scheme (MSC) and, if appropriate, complies with the Enhanced Capital Allowances (ECS) product criteria shall be submitted.

c) Prior to the final completion of each component including residential and non-residential units , the approved scheme shall incorporate, maintain measures and be designed to connect to an offsite district heating network to achieve an overall reduction in regulated CO2 emissions of at least 39.14% (equal to 188.34 tonnesCO2/yr) beyond Building Regulations Part L 2013 through the following carbon emission savings as detailed in the approved Sustainable Design and Construction Statement (2 March 2017), prepared by eb7 Ltd:

i. energy saving measures to achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 72.66 tonnes CO2 equating to 15.6% in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions over the compliant BR Part L 2013 base case.

ii. Installation of at least 25kWe/66.6kWth gas fired DH CHP system for the provision of space heating and hot water to the non-domestic components of the development, and overall achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 113.9 tonnes CO2 equating to at least 27.88% in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions over the Be Lean case of the Energy Hierarchy.

iii. Incorporation of solar PV panels with at least 25.5kWp capacity for the hotel and 3.96kWp for the new dwellings to achieve at least annual carbon dioxide emission savings of 1.77 tonnes CO2 equating to 27.88% in regulated carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions savings over the Be Lean stage of the Energy Hierarchy.

d) Measures to reduce the carbon dioxide emissions associated with other energy uses not covered by Building Regulations (un-regulated) should be incorporated prior to occupation and maintained in the development in perpetuity as detailed in the approved Sustainable Design and Construction Statement (2 March 2017), prepared by eb7 Ltd.
The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved.

Reason: To ensure that the dwellings within the development hereby approved are energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases and to minimise the impact of building emissions on local air quality in the interests of health, in accordance with policies 3.2, 5.3, 5.5, 5.6 and 7.14 of the London Plan (2016), policies 1.1(e), 1.1(j), 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, policies LV5.2 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD, and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.

21. The allocated space within the Development for an energy centre, hereby approved, shall be constructed in line with the approved Sustainable Design and Construction Statement (2 March 2017), prepared by eb7 Ltd and planning drawings, and retained prior to the first occupation of the development and shall thereafter serve the non-residential components of the Development and all dwellings (if appropriate).
The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To secure the space allocated for an energy centre for the site is designed in a manner which allows for the future connection to an offsite district heat network, and to ensure that the development contributes to reducing the use of fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity, and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases in accordance with policies 5.3, 5.5 and 5.6 of the London Plan 2016, policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of Ealing's adopted Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, policy LV5.2 of Ealing's Development Management DPD, and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG.

22. All boilers accommodated in the plant room to serve the energy requirements of the development should use Ultra low-NOx boilers with maximum NOx Emissions of under 0.030 g/kWh. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy 7.14 of The London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
23. The non-residential development should be registered with Building Research Establishment (BRE), achieve BREEAM Rating Excellent (based on the 2014 BREEAM NC Technical guidance).

i.    Within 3 months of completion of the non-residential building of the development, Interim BREEAM NC Assessment and related Certification verified by the BRE shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.

ii.    Within 3 months from the date of first use of the non-residential building of the development, BREEAM 'Post Construction Stage' Assessment and related Certification verified by the BRE should be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval confirming the BREEAM standard and measures have been implemented.

Following any approval of a 'Post Construction Stage' assessment and certificate of the development, the approved measures and technologies to achieve the BREEAM Excellent or higher standard shall be retained in working order for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policies 5.1, 5.2, 5.3, 5.6, 5.7 and 5.9 of the London Plan (2016), policies 1.1(k) and 1.2(f) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and policies 5.2 and 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

24. A detailed landscape plan for hard and soft landscaping including boundary treatment shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of any works on site.

Reason: To ensure that the development does not result in any net loss of tress in accordance with policy 5.10 of the Adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policy 5.10 of the London Plan (2016).

25. Detailed design, maintenance plans as per the Flood Risk Assessment issued in October 2015 (ref.111648/R3/2) and dwg 11648/2000 rev A shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of any works on site.

Reason: To ensure that the archaeological features are protected, in accordance with policies 5.12 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013) and policies 5.12 of the London Plan (2016).

26. No demolition or development shall take place until a written scheme of Archaeological investigation (WSI) has been submitted to and approved by the local planning authority in writing. For land that is included within the WSI, no demolition or development shall take place other than in accordance with the agreed WSI, which shall include the statement of significance and research objectives, and:
a) The programme and methodology of site investigation and recording and the nomination of a competent person(s) or organisation to undertake the agreed works.

b) The programme for post-investigation assessment and subsequent analysis, publication & dissemination and deposition of resulting material. this part of the condition shall not be discharged until these elements have been fulfilled in accordance with the programme set out in the WSI.
Reason: To ensure that the archaeological features are protected, in accordance with policies 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013 and policies 7.8 of the London Plan (2016).

27. The apart-hotel accommodation hereby approved shall be retained in a single planning unit and shall not be subdivided into independent residential units for the purpose of management, sale or rent. The rooms shall not be occupied other than by hotel visitors on a short stay basis (no greater than 3 months).
Reason: To ensure that the facility remains in use as hotel accommodation in accordance with Policies Q1 and ED12 of the Lambeth Local Plan (2015) and Policies 4.5 and 7.2 of the London Plan (2016).

28. Prior to the construction of the relevant part of the development, detailed drawings at a scale of 1:50 of the windows, doors and shopfronts, including details relating to the location, specification and extent of obscured glazing, in respect of each part of the development hereby permitted, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details prior to first use/occupation of the relevant part of each of the buildings. The obscured windows as approved shall then be retained permanently.

Reason: To ensure that the details of the windows, doors and shop fronts are appropriate for the development, and safeguard the character and appearance of the conservation area and to protect the amenity of surrounding residents from direct overlooking of internal spaces/loss of privacy in accordance with policies 7.4, 7A, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document 2013; and polices 7,4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan 2016.
